thread.title: Barb's Story
thread.title_full: Barb's Story - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: Kristin Kelly
title: Barb's Story
text:
BURLINGTON, Vt. - It's known by many different names; doctor-assisted suicide, right to die, death with dignity, end of life choices.
For two years Vermont has had a law on the books allowing terminally-ill patients to take prescribed doses of medicine to end their lives.
"It does surprise me because I think there are a lot of patients who think about it and a lot of patients who will actually make comments like 'if Iâ€™m going to go I'll just use x or y.' I think that this story and Barb's story will actually bring this to light and maybe this topic will be less tabooed," said Dr. Cheung Wong, UVM Medical Center gynecologic oncology.
Kristin Kelly explores this sensitive and divisive topic in a two-part special report called "Barb's Story" beginning tonight on the Channel 3 News at 6 p.m.
